alert.note: Alert for Craig; Nowata; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 6:45AM CDT until June 14 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CRAIG...NORTHERN ROGERS...EAST CENTRAL OSAGE... SOUTHERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHERN NOWATA AND NORTHEASTERN TULSA COUNTIES... At 645 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles east of Watova to 2 miles north of Oologah to 3 miles east of Skiatook, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Bartlesville... Claremore... Nowata... Skiatook... Collinsville... Chelsea... Oologah... Ramona... Ochelata... Delaware... Foyil... Avant... Talala... Vera... New Alluwe... Watova... Bushyhead... Wolco... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 245 and 251. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Nowata; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington
